description: From the (disused) order name Condylarthra, from Ancient Greek κόνδυλος (kóndulos, “knuckle”) + ἄρθρον (árthron, “joint”).

entries.meaning: Any of a group of extinct placental mammals, early ungulates, known from the Paleocene and Eocene epochs.
examples: In the 10 million years after the mass extinction, the first perissodactyls emerged from the confused wastebasket of animals called condylarths.
